info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Elkhart, southeastern Cass and southwestern St. Joseph Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elkhart, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Elkhart around 515 PM EDT. Dunlap around 520 PM EDT. Bristol around 530 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Middlebury. This includes Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 88 and 108. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
